segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so focused on drying that plate, like nothing else matters in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t help but notice the water rushing over the sink’s edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s forming a puddle on the floor, and she hasn’t even glanced down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if she slips? She’s so oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful and orderly, a stark contrast to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But my attention is drawn to the boy on the stool, stretching toward that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry for him; that stool looks nothing short of a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And there’s the girl, standing below him with her hand raised, eager for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so expectant, but does she realize how dangerous this is?
segments.speaker: PAR
